label: MT02792
info_overview: The devolo Home Control Smart Metering Plug is an intelligent wall socket that adds useful additional functions to all wall sockets present in the household. This enables connected devices to be switched on and off based on time control, either using rules configured in the Z-Wave-compatible control unit or using the corresponding app. In addition, the devolo Home Control Smart Metering Plug has an energy consumption measurement feature.
info_inclusion:
The Home Control Smart Metering Plug can be included using two different procedures:
Variant A: Auto Inclusion with the control unit

  1. In the Z-Wave-compatible control unit, start the procedure for adding a new device automatically.
  2. Plug the Home Control Smart Metering Plug into an available power socket. The Auto Inclusion is run. During the 2-minute timeout of the Auto Inclusion, Node Information Frames are sent within a few seconds. In the auto inclusion, it is not necessary to press the ON/OFF button.


Variant B: Manual Inclusion with the control unit If the time frame (2 minutes) of the Auto Inclusion procedure is exceeded, you can also include the Home Control Smart Metering Plug with the control unit manually.

  1. In the Z-Wave -compatible control unit, start the procedure for adding a new device (inclusion).
  2. Press the button of the connected Smart Metering Plug 3x within 1.2 seconds to start the inclusion process with the Z-Wave-compatible control unit.
info_exclusion:
1. Put the Z-Wave controller in Exclusion mode.
  2. Press the ON/OFF button 3x within 1.2 seconds to put the device into Exclusion mode. (indicated by white LED: 0.5 sec. ON, 0.5 sec. OFF).
  3. Node ID is now removed. (After the removal, the device starts again with Auto Inclusion mode.) Reset: Press the ON/OFF button for at least 10 sec. to reset the device to the factory defaults. After the reboot, the device starts Auto Inclusion again.

category_description: Small devices to be plugged into a power socket in a wall which stick there

parameters.label: Watt counter reporting period
parameters.overview: Enable automatic interval in seconds reporting with an interval of 5s * the value. Set to 0 will disable the autoreporting function.

parameters.label: KWh counter reporting period
parameters.overview: Enable automatic interval in minutes reporting with an interval of 10min * the value. Set to 0 will disable the autoreporting function.

parameters.label: Definition of  warning of current  load (A)
load caution threshold
parameters.overview: Enable automatic warning when the accumulated kWh power consumption exceeds the setting value from 1KWh ~ 10000KWh.. Set to 0 will disable kWh load caution reporting.

parameters.label: Mode for restoring  status
parameters.overview: Status of the plug if it is disconnected and reconnected from the mains power supply.

options.label: Switch will remain Off.
options.overview: Upon the return of AC power, the switch will remain Off.

options.label: resume previous state
options.overview: Upon the return of AC power, the switch will return to the state it was

options.label: Switch will turn On.
options.overview: Upon the return of AC power, the switch will turn On.

options.label: SWITCH OFF commands received are ignored.
SWITCH OFF commands received are honored.
The LED follows the state of the switch.
LED off with load ON
options.overview: Night Mode - When the switch is On, the LED is Off, and when the switch is off LED is on

options.label: Flash mode
options.overview: Flash Mode - When the state of the switch changes, the LED will be on

parameters.label: Auto off timer
parameters.description: Auto off timer. 0 will disable the auto off function.

options.label: When ALL OFF is received, MT2792 goes Off.
options.overview: When SWITCH ALL OFF is received, the MT2792 turns Off.

options.label: If ALL OFF is received, turn ON if it is OFF
options.overview: When SWITCH ALL OFF is received, the MT2792 will turn On if it is Off

options.label: WhenALL OFF is received, the MT2792 goes On.
options.overview: When SWITCH ALL OFF is received, the MT2792 turns On.

associations.label: Lifeline
associations.overview: The device sends a notification report of the command class battery report, notification report, and local device reset notification, binary report.

commandclass.name: NO_OPERATION
commandclass.label: No Operation - used for PINGing a device.
